Articles.Content:
True. I'm sorry.

The user below me plays the trumpet.

FALSE.

The User below me probably hasn't seen me for a while.

For truth's sake, I haven't seen you for at least 24 years... x-D

The user below me likes butnuts.

No.

The user below me likes bumping old good threads.

Ubecha.

The user below knows Chinese/Japanese/Korean.

Only the cuisine.

The user below me likes Thai food.

Nope. (No, wait, YES, I was ninja'd!)

The user below is currently sitting on the floor.

No.

The user below me has over 500 hours of ksp played.

I wish... I don't have that kind of time.

The user below me has named a kerbal after himself/herself.

False. I rather not see my Kerbal self die.

The user below me only know of me as that guy that made some forum game threads.

False. You're Lord Eggnog.

The me below has user.

Traceback (most recent call last):

File "<stdin>", line 3, in <module>

SyntaxError: Error when scanning string literal

The user below me knows enough about Python error messages to know where I screwed that up.

Nope, I am blissfully unaware of most programming conventions even though I did a few Comp Sci courses.

The user below me has flown in a prop plane.

Nope.

The user below me is a user.

False, I'm not just a user. This forum is my life.

The user below me understands, and knows how I feel.

Just a bit.

The user below me is usually a lurker.

I don't know. I have murdered many many wasps in revenge of my skin getting pierced.

Below user me the has bell taco ate.

Umm Yes? ( i think)

User below me dances when ever a kerbal poofs.

Yes, I commence the Macarena, aka The Memorial Dance.

The user below me has driven the good side of 100 miles per hour on at least one occasion.

Quite a few times when I was stationed in Germany.

The user below me has flown in a military aircraft

I have. C-130, C-2A Greyhound, and P-3 Orion to be specific.

The user below me is fat, wears a white T shirt, is bald and has yellow skin.

False and true wearing a white t shirt but not really fat and have a full head of hair.

The user below me has made at least one ssto.

Yes. SRB SSTO ftw.

The user below me has made a fully SRB ship that can into orbit.

Yep, though I haven't tried an SRB SSTO.

The user below me has visited Dres.

Yep! Dres's canyon is an outpost of the Kraken. Rovers roll uphill of their own accord and, if allowed to reach the edge of a terrain polygon, usually explode. As of 0.23, that is.

It's also really hard to get to on account of being tiny. Gravity's not high enough to make landing an issue, though.

The user below me uses a version of Linux besides Ubuntu.
